titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. VI. At the Office. Parish: for Canning’s Note, and with it Despatch from H. Middleton. N.W. Coast— Speransky— At P.U.S— He read a Paragraph of the draft of his Message—“and in North America” to be noticed— Cards to Harris, Morel, Cox and Winder at Strother’s— T. B. J. came from Frye’s— Letter from Charles, sick at Quincy— Walks— Chess— Stackelberg at the Office
2. VI. Come. Porter & T. R. Eldredge— To be Consul at Lima— At the Office Cowper about Young’s Slaves—examined the papers— Company to dinner. Tazewell and Tokai—

3. VI:15. T. B. J. left us. Heard Little. Prov. 10.29— Lecture, introductory to a course—customary in the English Society— Unitarians best informed— History of the Bible— P.M— Matthew 5.45. Mrs. A &c. at Baker’s Eve— She takes a pew there. Evening, made up Mrs Meigs’s papers to send to England—

4. VI:30. Eldredge here— George to Rockville. Stackelberg at the Office, with Bede’s narrative— F. C. Gray— Enquires about Connell— Also of papers relative to Claims agt. France— Barber of the Seminary— Asks Letter to my father— Letter to Duval. Application to Office work— Stackelberg here at Eve—

5. VI— At the Office— T. H. Howland of Alexandria, formerly of Maine. Bedford, to be Consul at Barbadoes— E. J. Lee his fees— Letter to Canning— West-India intercourse— George home— Smiths dined at Frye’s—the family there at Eve— Letters to E. Cruft about his bill. To J. A. Smith with Mrs Meigs’s papers.— Mr Crawford arrived.

6. VI. At the Office— R. N. Johnston from Mexico 6. Augt. Letters from Evans and W. Taylor— Mexican Government’s weakness and danger— 30 Millions Loan &c. Calhoun—for Bowie Dist. Atty. Florida and Cox. Leg. Council— Letter begun to Anduaga— Palmyra— Eve at Calhoun’s—dance— Wingate— Orne— Agg— Coxe. At Anderson—Comptroller’s— Mrs Meigs— The Circular— Hollingsworth’s Letter &c—

7. VI:30. Note for National Intelligencer— Letter from Jos. A. Ingersoll. At P.U.S. Met Calhoun there. Meeting fixed for to-morrow at 1—about the Note to Canning— Leave of absence to Miller— Draft of Message— Tribunal for Claims in Florida— Hollingsworth’s Letter. Answer to Anduaga at Office. Mrs A. unwell.

8. VI. Cabinet Meeting. Crawford and Calhoun— Canning’s Note & Draft of answer. West India & North American Colonies— [symbols][P.U.S.] objects to one expression— Letter to Anduaga— Palmyra case approved— Portuguese Charge d’Affaires arrived. His Letters— Letter to Anduaga— Tribunals— Cutts’s here at Eve— Chess with W. S. Smith. Walpole’s Memoires—Byng.

9. VI: Communication in National Intelligencer— Reply in City Gazette. At the Office— Menou— Letters from H. d. N. to 13 [symbols][September]— His honours, Hersant coming in 6. Brothers— Note to Canning— Addition— Letters from John and Charles— To Jos. Ingersoll & Charles. Calhoun to recommend Steele. Walpole’s Memoires— Satirical character.
10. VI. Heard Little. 2. Chronicles 19.11. and 1— Corinthians 15–34— The family heard Meade at Lowrie’s— Writing diary.

11. VI. T. Pinkney—with Treaty— Bailey with despatch from Forsyth. With Pinkney at P.U.S. Note from Constancio—from Stackelberg to D. Brent. Reading the despatches from Middleton and Forsyth. The Treaty— Castlereagh’s Instructions— New Ministry in Spain— San Miguel— The family heard M’Ginniss— I writing Diary— S. Thompson arrived

12— VI: Virgil H. Barber— Church at Claremont. Letter to my father. At P.U.S. Treaty. Forsyth’s despatch— Letters from Forbes Buenos-Ayres— Conspiracies— From Raguet and Sartoris— Rio— Independence— Draft of Message— England Colonial Intercourse— France— Convention Russia— do. South-America— Blockades Treasury Statements—four Millions over estimates— Tuyl’s Negotiation— How to be conducted— South-American Missions— Pinkney?— Visit to Angus— Petry and Laborie here— Whist— Constancio at the Office—from Portugal.

13. VI. With Constancio and Schmitz at P.U.S— After Conversation. Prevost. J. Robinson. Despatches— At Navy-Office— S. Thompson. Cruft’s Bill. N’York Elections— New
Midshipmen— At Office. Despatch from Forsyth 9. Septr. Enclosures— Come. Patterson here— Chess— Dr Thornton here— Mrs Middleton— George dined at T. Monroe’s.— Calhoun to recommend Simmons— Hull here.
14. VI. Force here— Book— Visit to Constancio and Schmitz— Anderson and M’Lean Commissioner of the Land-Office, at the Office— Draft to Anduaga— Company to dine— C. Pinkney’s music— Chess with Smith.

15. VI:30— D. Brent and Walsh, capture of Harriet— Baker— At the Office— Seaton Advance on Manufacture Returns— Gales— S. Thompson—case of Elton and Escandell— Letter to R. Emmons Epic Poet— To Anduaga— W. Pinkney dined and Eve, with us. Chess— Music.

16. VII. At the Office. R. Weightman— Bethune’s Bill— At P.U.S. Thompson there— Morel Acct. not to be paid. [symbols][P.U.S.] read paragraphs for the Message. South-Americans— Greeks— Europe unsettled— Spoke of R. Cutts and Lee— At Eve read Newspapers and Walpole— Tuesday—
17. VI:30. Heard Taylor— John 13.19. and 1. Corinth 10.32.

18. VI. Stackelberg at the Office— Consul at Norfolk— Waters the Constable— Lorich has left Philadelphia—gone to the Colony— Letters from J. B. Prevost St. Iago de Chile— 24. July— Jer. Robinson 5. Augt. contrasted view— Jones at Woeahoa—Sandwich Islands— Resolution of H.R— Clerks— Call upon them for Statements— W. S. Smith’s left us— Theatre— The family went—

19. VI:15. G. S. Bulfinch here with Taylor— At the Office. Come. Chauncey—claim for making Algerine Treaty— Charles Minifies— Office from [symbols][P.U.S.] Levy from Florida. Slaves captured in Genl. Ramirez. Asks their restoration to the owner by executive order— At [symbols][P.U.S.] did not see him— Assorting papers. Johnson Hellen here— Read Newspapers— Writing to Hopkinson—

20. VI:30— Mrs Davis and another here. Baptist Meeting House at Navy-Yard. Metropolis Bank. Genl. Van Ness— Mrs Middleton worse— Eclipse and Sir Charles Race— At the Office— Levy— Genl. Ramirez— Resolution H.R. 7. May Clerks— Eve— Petry and Smith’s here— Letter to Hopkinson— Note from Canning

21. VI:30. At the Office— J. Marshall jr. to recommend H. Dixon. Marine Corps— To Secy of Navy’s— Dubourg, Bishop of Louisiana— Claim of the Ursuline Nuns. New-Orleans— At [symbols][P.U.S.] with Canning’s Note, Letter from C. Raguet &c— Letters from J. Robinson, Devereux & Marbois— Levy— His road— To petition Congress— Duties of State Department— George dined at Stackelberg’s— Carusi’s Race-Ball— The family went.
22. VI:30. Rain—all day— At the Office— Letters to W. P. Duvall, and A. H. Everett— Duties of State Department— Card to J. Marshall jr. at Strother’s— R. Derby gone.

23. VII: Charles J. F. Alden here. Robbed by Pirates— Alleghany College— At the Races— Lady Lightfoot and Tyro— Then 6 horses— 5. 1 mile heats. 3 best. Quaker— Not crowded— Frye there— Office— Large Mail— Despatches from A. Gallatin— 6. Brothers arrived— Neither Tuyll nor Hersant— Pinkney— Cox, Parish, Laborie, Thornton’s, Mrs Smith here— Chess with Thornton

24. VI. Heard Taylor A.M. Luke 16.2. Mrs. Middleton’s funeral at 1— Heard Campbell P.M. 2. Timothy 4.7— Letters from Madame Bourke & Brancia W. S. Smith’s dined with us. Frye’s here and J. P. Todd this Eve.

25. VI:30. M’Closkey here for a certificate. M’Gowan for a Clerkship.— At the Office— Bates of Arkansas— Miller’s, Crittenden’s & Scott’s Commissions Ch.— Minifie—for Office— G. Hay—going to Virginia. Sheffey— Canning. Note about rolled and hammered iron— Colonial intercourse—discriminating duties— Congress will be liberal— English colonial settlements liberal— Eve at Dr Thornton’s— Tingey’s & Wingate’s— Chess.

26. V. Note from [symbols][P.U.S.]. Cabinet Meeting at 1— Crawford, Calhoun, Thompson present— The Message— Calhoun’s remarks, Value for Cost— Crawford’s on the Russian Convention— Mine on the West-Point Academy— To meet again to-morrow— Calhoun at the Office about the Message— Evening; wrote to Walsh

27. VI:— Cabinet Meeting, as yesterday. The Message, by paragraphs. Internal— Supervision— Including a Convention, Prediction of reaction—to be omitted— Barbary Piracy— Charge on European Powers—to be considered. Greek Sublime Porte— Self Eulogy— Cumberland road double references to opinion— Visits to J. S. Johnston—and M’Lean of Land-Office— Rector— At the Office. Ri. Weightman for Bethune and another— Eve at Mrs Decatur’s— Calhoun’s and Canning— Literary and Political.— Swartwout.

28. VI:30. Note from Maury— Armstrong papers. At Office—back— R. M. Johnson J. Johnson and Chambers— Clerkship H.R— Note from [symbols][P.U.S.] Cabinet Meeting. Missions to South-America— Crawford in favour of sending them. But thinks there is less reason for it than there was last Spring— State of the different Countries. Crawford talks about Cuba— Hyde’s confidential communication to him— An agent at Cuba— M’Rea— Wyer— Calhoun’s remarks to me— Dined at Canning’s.

29. VII— C. Bulfinch here. American Atlas— Mrs Hellen’s Letter— D. Brent— 2. Reports. D. P. Cook— At the Office— Russell, from Gaillard— Bailey for M’Kenney— Calhoun Joel Lewis’s Letter. Evening idle.
30. VI:15. J. W. Taylor here. Jos. Nourse and A. Morris— At the Office— Convention documents. At [symbols][P.U.S.] Wirt there— Thompson came in— Letter from Menou Mrs A— Eve at Frye’s.
